perturbation.original_text:
“Subscriber” means any individual who purchases mobile content programming and: (a) who actually pays the applicable Subscription Fee; and (b) does not
receive a refund of such Subscription Fee for any reason within thirty (30) days from the end of the payment period for which the Subscription Fee was paid. A
Subscriber remains a “Subscriber” for the purposes of this Agreement so long as such individual continues to pay the applicable Subscription Fee.
perturbation.changed_text: “Subscriber” means any individual who accesses mobile content programming through Distributor’s portal, regardless of whether a Subscription Fee is applicable or paid. A Subscriber remains a 'Subscriber' for the purposes of this Agreement for a period of 30 days from the date of initial access.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Subscriber' hinges on payment of a Subscription Fee and the absence of refunds within 30 days, thus linking subscriber status to financial transactions. The modified definition broadens the scope to include anyone accessing content, irrespective of payment, and restricts the 'Subscriber' status to a fixed 30-day period, regardless of continued usage. This introduces a contradiction concerning subscriber qualifications and duration of subscriber status.

perturbation.original_text:
IMNTV will extend the Agreement on the same terms and conditions for additional one-year terms,
providing Distributor and IMNTV agree, predicated on satisfactory performance by both parties
perturbation.changed_text: IMNTV may extend the Agreement for additional one-year terms at its sole discretion. Such extensions are not predicated on the Distributor's performance but contingent upon IMNTV's internal strategic objectives.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stipulates that the agreement extension is contingent upon both parties agreeing, based on satisfactory performance by both sides. The modified version grants IMNTV sole discretion in extending the agreement, removing the requirement of mutual agreement and shifting the basis of extension to IMNTV's internal objectives, contradicting the initial clause.

perturbation.original_text:
The Programming will have a IMNTV Identification (“IMNTV ID”), which is similar to on-air network id, which is played each time the Programming is
launched. Distributor may utilize the IMNTV ID in the Distributor’s Portal for promotional purposes.
perturbation.changed_text: The Programming may optionally include an IMNTV Identification (“IMNTV ID”) at IMNTV’s discretion. Distributor is prohibited from using the IMNTV ID in the Distributor’s Portal or any other promotional materials without express written consent from IMNTV.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the programming WILL have an IMNTV ID and that the distributor MAY utilize it for promotional purposes. The modified text makes the inclusion of the ID optional and prohibits the distributor from using it for promotion without explicit consent, creating a direct contradiction.
